com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.write

Class DelimitedTextTableWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.write.TextTableWriter
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.write.DelimitedTextTableWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RuntimeCloseable, TableWriter, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CsvTableWriter

    public class DelimitedTextTableWriter
extends TextTableWriter
    The DelimitedTextTableWriter class provides a TableWriter implementation for writing data tables to single character delimited text files. The delimiter is specified when constructing the writer. The first line in the output is a delimiter character-separated list of column names, and each subsequent line holds a delimiter character-separated list of row data. More information about the specifics of the formatting can be found in the documenation for DelimitedDataFormat.

      • writeRow

        protected void writeRow(java.lang.Object[] dataRow,
            TextFormat[] format)
        Description copied from class: TextTableWriter
        Write a row of data with the specified formats. It can (should) be assumed that the number of row data elements and formats will be equal (i.e. that bounds checking has already been performed).
        Specified by:
        writeRow in class TextTableWriter
        Parameters:
        dataRow - The row data to be written.
        format - The formats for each element (column) in the data row.
